Overview Description:

The extension point schema editor will not edit schemas for projects that are 
created external to the workspace. If a project is created in the default 
location (i.e. within the workspace directory structure) the editor works fine.

Steps to Reproduce: 

1) Create a PDE plug-in with a location that is external to the workspace.
2) Create a new extension point for the plug-in.
3) Open the extension point schema editor and try to click on the 'Definition' 
or 'Documentation' tab.

Actual Results:

A dialog pops up a dialog with the following text:

    The source page has errors. Other pages cannot be used until these errors 
are corrected.

Expected Results:

Expected to be able to edit the schema.

Build Date & Platform:

Build 200206271827 on Windows 2000 Professional. 

Additional Builds and Platforms:

Build 200207220012 on Windows 2000 Professional.

I also have encountered this bug. When the schema file is loaded by the 
underlying Eclipse classes, it seems to prepend any relative path with the 
workspace directory. This obviously causes problems when the projects 
themselves may not physically be located in that directory and may be scattered 
in a number of directories, which is what has occurred in my case. 

I have two plugins. One provides an extension point and a schema
describing the point. The other extends the point. Neither project is in 
the "Workspace" directory. When the plugin extending the point seeks the .exsd 
file, it's looking for it at the relative directory "x:\workspace\relativepath" 
when it should be looking for it in the same place the root plugin source is
located, which would be something like "y:\source\relativepath". 

This is a show stopper for us at this point and any help would be greatly 
appreciated.

Thanks.
